mygrad.nnet.sigmoid¶

mygrad.nnet.sigmoid(x, constant=False)[source]¶

Applies the sigmoid activation function:

f(x) = 1 / (1 + exp(-x))
Parameters:
x : array_like

sigmoid is applied element-wise on x.

constant : bool, optional(default=False)

If True, the returned tensor is a constant (it does not back-propagate a gradient)
Returns:
mygrad.Tensor

Examples

>>> import mygrad as mg
>>> from mygrad.nnet import sigmoid
>>> x = mg.linspace(-5, 5, 10)
>>> sigmoid(x)
Tensor([0.00669285, 0.02005754, 0.0585369 , 0.1588691 , 0.36457644,
    0.63542356, 0.8411309 , 0.9414631 , 0.97994246, 0.99330715])
